natural problem: How many whole numbers less than $18,\!632$ are congruent to $ 23 \pmod {37} $?
natural solution: Every positive integer, $ n \equiv 23\pmod{37}, $ can be written in the form: $23 + 37k$.
$$ Counting the number of elements in this set yields $502-0+1= \boxed{503}$ positive integers less than 18,632 which are congruent to $23\pmod{37}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: int
assumes h0 : "x mod 37 = 23"
and h1 : "x < 18632"
shows  "card {x. (x mod 37 = 23 \<and> x < 18632)} = 503"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 How many whole numbers less than $18,\!632$ are congruent to $ 23 \pmod {37} $? The final Answer is 503
 ### Proof
 Every positive integer, $ n \equiv 23\pmod{37}, $ can be written in the form: $23 + 37k$.
 Thus for every $n<18,632,$ $$0 < 23+37k < 18,632.$$ Since $k$ must be a whole number, $$0 \le k \le 502.$$ The set of all $ n \equiv 23\pmod{37} < 18,632$ is then: $$ \{ 23+37(0), \; 23+37(1), \; 23+37(2), \; ..., \; 23+37(502) \}.
 $$ Counting the number of elements in this set yields $502-0+1= \boxed{503}$ positive integers less than 18,632 which are congruent to $23\pmod{37}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: int
assumes h0 : "x mod 37 = 23"
and h1 : "x < 18632"
shows  "card {x. (x mod 37 = 23 \<and> x < 18632)} = 503"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: How many integers less than 18632 leave a remainder of 23 when divided by 37? The final answer is 503.

 $$ Counting the number of elements in this set yields $502-0+1= \boxed{503}$ positive integers less than 18,632 which are congruent to $23\pmod{37}.$
 *)
